Comment 2: 
This seems confusing.

If I never share the address of something, I'd presume that its address is not known by
anyone. I could always do "(&t).Foo()" if I desired this behavior.

To me, this seems on par with having a "func Bar(p *T)" work with "var t T; Bar(t)".

Wasn't "always explicit, never implicit" part of the motto?

Perhaps the spec should be reworded to make it clear that code like this should work.
